definitions.definition: very tired, especially after working hard for a long time:
examples: I think he's a little weary after his long journey.

definitions.definition: bored with something because you have experienced too much of it:
examples: I've been going out with the same people to the same places for years and I've just grown weary of it.
Children weary me with their constant questions and demands.

definitions.definition: to start to feel that something or someone is boring:
examples: Some people never seem to weary of eating the same type of food every day.
